thread.title: US man who moved a river ordered to pay restitution
thread.title_full: US man who moved a river ordered to pay restitution | News24

author: news24.com
title: US man who moved a river ordered to pay restitution
text:
Seattle - A Washington state court has ordered a man who redirected a river to pay restitution of $50 a month into an environmental fund, the state's top lawyer said on Monday.
William Cayo Sr was found guilty in April of violating water pollution and shoreline management laws as well as conducting prohibited hydraulic activities when he changed a Tahuya River channel in February 2013, Attorney General Bob Ferguson said.
Cayo used an excavator and bulldozer to fill the river channel near his home and redirect the river, Ferguson said, adding that, in all, Cayo filled and graded nearly 0.6 hectares of riverbed.
Cayo has served 30 days in jail and was ordered to pay $8 000 in fines, Ferguson said in a statement on Monday.
